Detailed Description

Directory Block struct.

Field Documentation

long bDirBlock::access
 

140
Protection flags (set to 0 by default).

If MultiUser FileSystem : Owner
Bit If Set, Means
0 Delete forbidden (D)
1 Not executable (E)
2 Not writable (W)
3 Not readable (R)
4 Is archived (A)
5 Pure (re-entrant safe), can be made resident (P)
6 File is a script (Arexx or Shell) (S)
7 Hold bit. if H+P (and R+E) are set the file can be made resident on first load (OS 2.x and 3.0)
8 Group (D) : is delete protected
9 Group (E) : is executable
10 Group (W) : is writable
11 Group (R) : is readable
12 Other (D) : is delete protected
13 Other (E) : is executable
14 Other (W) : is writable
15 Other (R) : is readable
16-30 Reserved
31 SUID, MultiUserFS Only

014
Checksum.

149
Comment (max. 79 chars permitted).

long bDirBlock::days
 

1a4
Last access date (days since 1 jan 78).

char bDirBlock::dirName[MAXNAMELEN+1]
 

1b1
Directory name (max. 30 chars permitted).

long bDirBlock::extension
 

1f8
FFS: first directory cache block.

long bDirBlock::hashTable[HT_SIZE]
 

018
Hash table (entry block number). Size = (BSIZE/4) - 56. For floppy disks, size = 72.

long bDirBlock::hashTableSize
 

00c
UNUSED (= 0).

1d8
FFS: linked list of hard links (first = newest).

1f0
